content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

<question>
Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".
</question>

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    cleaned = lowercase(col)
    cleaned = strip(cleaned)
    cleaned = replace(cleaned, r"[ \-]+" => "_")
    return cleaned
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input and performs the following operations:

1. `lowercase(col)` converts the string to all lowercase characters.
2. `strip(cleaned)` removes any leading or trailing whitespace characters from the string.
3. `replace(cleaned, r"[ \-]+" => "_")` replaces any occurrences of one or more spaces or hyphens with an underscore using a regular expression pattern.
4. The cleaned string is returned.

You can call this function like `clean_column("My Column")` which will return `"my_column"`.
